Chapter 2 Statements A statement is a remark or declaration. Here are some examples: Life is pain. I am 19 years old. I like your hat. London is the capital of Great Britain. 2.1 Non-statements So what is not a statement? Ive listed four types of non-statements below. Can you think of any other types? 2.1.1 Fragments Fish. I am. Bro. These are incomplete sentences, and are therefore not statements. 2.1.2 Questions What is \(2 \cdot 2\)? Are you going to eat that? What is this life if full of care? Anything that ends with a question mark is not a statement; its a question. 2.1.3 Implicit answers \(162.5\) Yes it is. The day after tomorrow. Anything that answers a question, without explicitly referencing the question, is not a statement. Or at least, not one that we can work with. 2.1.4 Exclamations Dang! Ura! Phew! 2.2 What makes a good statement? Not all statements are equally good! Some are better than others. Follow the rules below for high-quality statements: 2.2.1 All the words should be clear and understandable All the words in a statement should either already be understood by the reader, or should be easy to Google. Lets look at some examples: Bishkek is the capital of the Kyrgyz Republic. This is nice and clear. We know what the Kyrgyz Republic is, we know what Bishkek is, and we know what a capital is. The human foot is comprised of 26 bones. Again, this statement is nice and clear. We know what each term means. An atom of uranium has one more electron than an atom of protactinium. We might not understand every term here, but we could use Google to find out more. The candidate won the popular vote but lost the election. This isnt clear, and no matter how much Googling we do, we wont be able to clarify the details. We need to ask the author of the statement: Which election? Which year? Which candidate? I love you. On its own, this statement isnt clear enough. Who is speaking, and to whom? Once we understand that, we need to ask whether love is clearly defined? Are we talking about something from the soul? Something biological? Familiar love? Friendship? 1000 is a large number. Theres only one word here which is not clear: large. Its not clear how the author is defining large. Maybe the author could change the statement to compare it with something: 1000 is larger than 500. 1000 people died today in our country, the largest daily total since the global pandemic began. 1000 is the largest number for which the Romans had a symbol. In all three of these statements, the word ``large has now been given clear meaning. 2.2.2 No paradoxes! Paradoxes contradict themselves. These statements rely more on tricks of language: This statement is not clear. This statement is false. The statement below is not true. The statement above is true. Because paradoxes are built to contradict themselves, they arent much use to us. Therefore well avoid them in this course.1 Exercise 2.1 Can you find any other paradoxical statements? What makes them paradoxical? 2.2.3 Statements should stand on their own Dont you hate that feeling when you start watching a film but nothing makes sense because you didnt watch the previous films in the series?2 A good statement should stand on its own, and not rely on the reader knowing previous statements. If it does assume knowledge of previous statements, they should be referenced or restated, like including a plot synopsis for the previous movies! Now its your turn. Bring your answers to our next class. Going forward, all statements will be coloured yellow, Exercise 2.2 Take a look at the statements below. Are all the terms clear? Do you understand all the terms? If not, do you think you could find out their meaning on your own? Do any of the statements need more explanation by the author? It is hot today. It is hotter today than it was yesterday. The highest temperature on record, 54.4\(^{\circ}\)C or 130\(^{\circ}\)F, was measured on 16th August 2020 at the Death Valley National Park in California. The explosion in Beirut in August 2020 could have been avoided. 24 is a nice number. 28 is a perfect number. Two negatives make a positive. Aman has a twin sister. Ariana Grande was the most streamed artist of the year. On average it rains more in Wales than it does in Kyrgyzstan. Solution. 1. It is not clear what hot means. Definitions of hot will vary around the world and from person to person. 2. This is clearer than the previous statement, however we could benefit from knowing where this statement is talking about. Bishkek? New York? Night time? Day time? 3. This is pefectly clear. We know where and when the statement is talking about, that it is referring to a peak temperature, and that it is not claiming that this was indeed the highest temperature ever on Earth, merely that it is the highest on record. Gunnar Garfors has visited every country in the world. People find it harder to concentrate on one task than they used to. Mobile phones have gotten more powerful over time.
